freenet.io
Class NetworkInterface

java.lang.Object
  freenet.io.NetworkInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SSLNetworkInterface
public class NetworkInterface
extends Object
implements Closeable

Replacement for ServerSocket that can handle multiple bind addresses and allows IP address level filtering.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
David Roden <droden@gmail.com>

Constructor Detail

NetworkInterface

protected NetworkInterface(int port,
                           String allowedHosts,
                           Executor executor)
                    throws IOException
Creates a new network interface that can bind to several addresses and allows connection filtering on IP address level.

Parameters:
bindTo - A comma-separated list of addresses to bind to
allowedHosts - A comma-separated list of allowed addresses
Throws:
IOException

setSoTimeout

public void setSoTimeout(int timeout)
                  throws SocketException
Sets the SO_TIMEOUT value on the server sockets.

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout in milliseconds, 0 to disable
Throws:
SocketException - if the SO_TIMEOUT value can not be set
See Also:
ServerSocket.setSoTimeout(int)

accept

public Socket accept()
Waits for a connection. If a timeout has been set using setSoTimeout(int) and no connection is established this method will return after the specified timeout has been expired, throwing a SocketTimeoutException. If no timeout has been set this method will wait until a connection has been established.

Returns:
The socket that is connected to the client or null if the timeout has expired waiting for a connection

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes this interface and all underlying server sockets.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
See Also:
ServerSocket.close()
